org.catechis
Class FileStorage

java.lang.Object
  org.catechis.FileStorage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Storage
public class FileStorage
extends java.lang.Object
implements Storage

This class should be a link class only. It should be able to take user info and then parlay with other objects, like JDOMSoultion, to get the requested info and then return it.

The early methods break this ideal, because we didnt quite understand the role that the Storgae object should play. The later methods, like the update* methods Dont do any processing, but send out to other objects to do this. Again, those other objects should only do what they specialize in, such as JDOMSolution doing only xml specific things, where as helper methods should be elsewhere so that they can be shared by different Storage methods, such as MySQL or Hibernate, etc.

getWordObject

public Word getWordObject(java.lang.String search_property,
                          java.lang.String search_value,
                          java.lang.String category,
                          java.lang.String user_name)
The search_property is either text, definition, of id. The search value is the desired text or def value, category is the file name, and user-name speaks for itself.

Specified by:

Parameters:

search_value - is the desired text or def value,
category - is the file name. It can have the xml file extension or not. We check.
user-name - speaks for itself.

The word object with all elements.

getFilteredWordObjects

public java.util.Vector getFilteredWordObjects(WordFilter word_filter,
                                               java.lang.String user_name)

Narrow down a list with a filter object (which has properties like a min and max reading or writing levels, start position, etc).

Min and man levels determine what range of words can be returned,

and it only looks for words of a certain type, that is reading or writing.

The JDOMSolution object method getFilteredWords is used. The first argument length can be -all- which filteres the entire list.

Specified by:
getFilteredWordObjects in interface Storage

getTestStats

public AllTestStats getTestStats(java.util.Vector tests,
                                 java.lang.String user_name)
We create a bean containing all the statistics for a users word tests.

An array of blank TestStat objects with the appropriate size needs to be created first as set so that each TestStat can be reset with the real thing during a while loop.

The average test score is clalculated here, but should really be done in stats. But something has to take the running total of tests and divide it by the total test count, and then set the result in the AllTestStats object, so then again this isnt such a bad place to do it. Really there needs to be another object that takes taks like this away from FileStorage so that the future HibernateStorage can use it also.

Specified by:
getTestStats in interface Storage

updateWord

public void updateWord(WordTestMemory wtm,
                       WordTestResult wtr,
                       java.lang.String user_name,
                       java.lang.String encoding)
This method takes all the test and word info in the two object arguments and replaces the old values with them, wether they have all been changed or not.

It is assumed that the calling method has confirmend that at least one thing has changed, so while wee at it, we update all values, so that we dont;t have to do each one separately later.

updateWordLevel

public java.lang.String updateWordLevel(WordTestMemory wtm,
                                        WordTestResult wtr,
                                        java.lang.String user_name,
                                        java.lang.String encoding)
This method takes all the test and word info in the two object arguments and finds the word writing/reading level and increments or decrements it based on the pass/fail attribute set in the wtr.grade..

The string returned represents the new word reading or writing level that is adjusted in the JDOMSoulution method replaceWordAndChangeTest.

addWord

public void addWord(Word word,
                    java.lang.String file_name,
                    java.lang.String user_name,
                    java.lang.String encoding)
Here we just add a word to a file.

The FileJDOMWordLists takes the user folder as a contructor, and adds reading.list and writing.list to add the words id and filename to each of these files inside the useres vocab/lists/ folder.

We also have to add a words last and next test date record (wltd/wntd), with writing being one rate of testing delta (rotd) value higher than reading.

Specified by:
addWord in interface Storage

Get exclusive categories. Load the daily test marks (i = category in list, j = word in the category). Create a list of words within the WLTD object. Set the new daily test marks. return the key list to acess the words. described as a hash of Word objects using a test date as a key in the WLTD docs.

scoreSingleWordTest

public WordTestResult scoreSingleWordTest(AllWordsTest awt,
                                          java.lang.String user_name)
AllWordsTest // data kept on xml file private String text; private String definition; private String category; private String test_type;

First we set the search criteria. If it is a reading test, that means the user has seen the word in a foreign language (the text element), and they have typed in the meaning in their own language (the definition element), so we look for the original text element with the value from the AllWordsTest objet.

Then we have to match the searched for text/definition, for a reading test, we want to mathc the returnd definition with the field0 property of the test_form, which the user has typed in to score the test as pass or fail.

Specified by:
scoreSingleWordTest in interface Storage

Description copied from interface: Storage
*** Not implemented. We call fuo.createNewLists when deleting a word instead of saving keys everytime we create lists.

This method is called in this way:

com.businessglue.struts.options.UpdateOptionsConfirmAction

FileUserOptions.createNewLists(user_id, subject, context_path);

WordLastTestDates.createNewLists(categories, store, user_id);

The category DOM should be in memory when this method is called.
